description: Name of bus to which load is attached.
Placeholder for load type. Not yet implemented.
Active power consumption (positive if the load is consuming power).
Reactive power consumption (positive if the load is inductive).
Inverter control type, supported types are: q_v (v1, v2, v3, v4, s_nom, power_factor, damper), fixed_cosphi (power_factor) , and cosphi_p (set_p1,  set_p2, s_nom, power_factor_min) .
Power factor is default to 1 and can take values (1 = >  power_factor  >  0), required when the type_of_control_strategy is chosen 'fixed_cosphi' and or 'q_v'.
Inverter nominal apparent power, required when the type_of_control_strategy is chosen 'q_v'  or  'cosphi_p'.
Minimum voltage magnitude per unit for left curve of q_v controller, required when the type_of_control_strategy is chosen  'q_v'.
Maximum voltage magnitude per unit for left curve of q_v controller, required when the type_of_control_strategy is chosen  'q_v'.
Minimum voltage magnitude per unit for right curve of q_v controller, required when the type_of_control_strategy is chosen  'q_v'.
Maximum voltage magnitude per unit for right curve of q_v controller, required when the type_of_control_strategy is chosen  'q_v'.

Damper value is default to 1 but it can take values (1 > =  damper  >  0) and controls output of the voltage dependent controllers by changing its value in case controller is not converging,  (it is multiplied to the controller output ),  required when the type_of_control_strategy is chosen  'q_v'  or  'p_v' .

It is a set point  in percentage,  where it tells the controller to work with unity power factor if  (injected_power / s_nom)*100  <  set_p1, required when the type_of_control_strategy is  chosen  'cosphi_p'.

It is a set point in percentage,  where it tells controller to work with 'power_factor_min' if  (injected_power / s_nom)*100   >  set_p2,  required when the type_of_control_strategy is  chosen  'cosphi_p'.
Minimum allowed power factor, required when the type_of_control_strategy is chosen  'cosphi_p' .
active power at bus (positive if net load)
